CoreGroup.description: Default Core Group. The default core group cannot be deleted.
CoreGroup.name: DefaultCoreGroup

AllActivePolicy.description: SIP All-active-policy with quorum disabled by default
AllActivePolicy.name: Default Sip Quorum Policy

J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere MQ Resource Adapter

J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for WebSphere Persistence
J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specify whether connection handles support implicit reactivation. (Smart Handle support). Value may be "true" or "false".
J2EEResourceProperty.name: InactiveConnectionSupport

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Type of transaction resource registration (enlistment). Valid values are either "static" (immediate) or "dynamic" (deferred).
J2EEResourceProperty.name: TransactionResourceRegistration

J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for WebSphere Persistence
J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter

CommonDescription.value: A constant indicating the type of connection factory: WSJdbcDataSource (1) or WSRdbConnectionFactory (2)

J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for WebSphere Persistence
J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter

CommonDescription.value: A constant indicating the type of connection factory: WSJdbcDataSource (1) or WSRdbConnectionFactory (2)

JDBCProvider.description: Microsoft SQL Server JDBC Driver. This provider is configurable in version 6.1.0.15 and later nodes.
JDBCProvider.name: MS-SQL for JPetStore

DataSource.description: Data source for the Microsoft SQL Server JDBC Driver. This data source type is configurable in version 6.1.0.15 and later nodes.
DataSource.name: MS-SQL for JPetStore

J2EEResourceProperty.description: URL for connecting to the database, starting with 'jdbc:sqlserver://'. Do not specify passwords via the URL. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information about valid URL formats.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: URL

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The application name associated with the data source. The application name is used by some Microsoft SQL Server tools for profiling and logging.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: applicationName

J2EEResourceProperty.description: If beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a result set scrolling operation is performed.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: beginTranForResultSetScrollingAPIs

J2EEResourceProperty.description: If beginTranForVendorAPIs is enabled, the application server attempts to begin a transaction or enlist in a transaction when the connection is not currently enlisted in a transaction and a vendor API is invoked with the wrapper pattern or with WSCallHelper.jdbcCall or WSCallHelper.jdbcPass.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: beginTranForVendorAPIs

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Determines whether connections are shared based on the current state of the connection (-1) or the original connection request (0). To specify with greater granularity which connection properties are matched based on the current state, you may combine the following constants by adding them together: 1=transaction isolation level, 2=read only, 4=holdability, 8=type map, 16=catalog.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: connectionSharing

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The name of the database.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: databaseName

J2EEResourceProperty.description: A description of this data source.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: description

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Indicates if SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) encryption should be used for communication with the database. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: encrypt

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The error detection model determines how fatal connection and statement errors are detected, including which types of exceptions are raised to the application. Under the ExceptionChecking model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper only to identify errors. The application server does not replace exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. Under the ExceptionMapping model, the application server uses the error mapping facility defined in the Data Store Helper to detect fatal connection and statement errors. The application server overrides exceptions thrown by the JDBC driver with exceptions defined in the error map of the Data Store Helper. The ExceptionMapping setting is not compliant with JDBC 4.0 and above, but is necessary for applications written according to the WebSphere Application Server exception mapping model.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: errorDetectionModel

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The server name of a failover server to use for database mirroring. The failoverPartner applies only when the first connection attempt to the primary server fails. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: failoverPartner

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Controls whether or not the application server automatically frees Arrays, Blobs, Clobs, NClobs, SQLXMLs, InputStream, and Readers when the object that created them is closed. The ability to free resources is contingent on the JDBC driver supporting the free (or close) method.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: freeResourcesOnClose

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Host name used to validate the SSL certificate of the database. Applies only when encrypt is true and trustServerCertificate is false. The serverName is used if not specified. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: hostNameInCertificate

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies the instance name. This is necessary if Microsoft SQL Server named instances are used.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: instanceName

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Controls whether Windows integrated security or SQL Server authentication is used to connect to the database. If using integrated security, you must empty the connection pool each time you log in as a different user, in order to avoid retrieving connections from the pool for the wrong user.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: integratedSecurity

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies whether to allow JMS to get optimized connections from this datasource. This option will prevent JDBC Applications from getting connections from this datasource.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: jmsOnePhaseOptimization

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Causes batch statements to return only the last update count. By default, all update counts are returned.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: lastUpdateCount

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for a lock before timing out. -1 indicates the attempt to acquire a lock never times out. 0 indicates the attempt times out immediately.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: lockTimeout

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to the database before timing out. A value of zero indicates the connection attempt does not time out.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: loginTimeout

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Setting this flag to true will cause the Application Server to never enlist the connections from this datasource in global or local transactions. Applications must explicitly call setAutoCommit(false) on the connection if they want to start a local transaction on the connection and they must commit or rollback the transaction that they started.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: nonTransactionalDataSource

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies the size (in bytes) of network packets transmitted between the data source and Microsoft SQL Server. The value specified for packet size must be within 512 bytes to 32767 bytes.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: packetSize

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The TCP/IP port number where Microsoft SQL Server resides.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: portNumber

J2EEResourceProperty.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-testing of connection is enabled for the connection pool, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1, will be used at runtime.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: preTestSQLString

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies whether to allow reauthentication of connections. This option requires implementation of the doConnectionSetupPerTransaction() method on the DataStoreHelper where the reauthentication is expected to take place.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: reauthentication

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Values are adaptive or full. Determines whether a minimal amount of data is buffered or if the full result is transmitted from the server when a statement is run. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: responseBuffering

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies the type of cursors uses for SQL query results. Values are 'direct' (the default) or 'cursor'. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: selectMethod

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies how string parameters are transmitted to the database, as unicode (the default) or in native format for the database.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The host name of the server where Microsoft SQL Server resides.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: serverName

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Determines if the JDBC driver validates the SSL certificate of the database. A value of false causes the JDBC driver to validate the SSL certificate. Applies only when encrypt is true. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: trustServerCertificate

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Fully qualified path to the certificate trust store file. If unspecified, the JDBC driver determines the certificate store based on the trust manager factory's lookup rules. Applies only when encrypt is true and trustServerCertificate is false. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: trustStore

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Password for the trust store. Applies only when encrypt is true and trustServerCertificate is false. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: trustStorePassword

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Overlays existing entries in the error map by invoking DataStoreHelper.setUserDefinedMap. The userDefinedErrorMap can be used to add, change, or remove entries from the error map. Entries are delimited by ; (semicolon). Each entry consists of a key and value, where the key is an error code (numeric value) or SQLState (text enclosed in double quotes). Keys and values are are separated by = (equals sign). For example, to remove the mapping of SQLState S1000, add a mapping of error code 1062 to DuplicateKeyException, and add a mapping of SQLState 08004 to StaleConnectionException, the following can be specified for userDefinedErrorMap: "S1000"=;1062=com.ibm.websphere.ce.cm.DuplicateKeyException;"08004"=com.ibm.websphere.ce.cm.StaleConnectionException
J2EEResourceProperty.name: userDefinedErrorMap

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Setting this flag to true will cause to WebSphere Application Server to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database if the validation fails. Setting this flag to false prevents any additional validation from being performed - newly created connections are assumed to be valid and usable.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: validateNewConnection

J2EEResourceProperty.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up
J2EEResourceProperty.name: validateNewConnectionRetryCount

J2EEResourceProperty.description: This is useful only if validateNewConnection flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database. Unit is seconds
J2EEResourceProperty.name: validateNewConnectionRetryInterval

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies the timeout in seconds for testing connections (either new or pooled by the application server) to the database. If the timeout expires before validating then the connection is considered unusable. If retries are configured, the full value of the timeout applies to each retry. A value of 0 indicates the JDBC driver does not impose a timeout on validation attempts. This data source attribute applies to JDBC 4.0 drivers and above. Unit is seconds
J2EEResourceProperty.name: validateNewConnectionTimeout

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Specifies a default transaction isolation level for new connections. Resource References and Access Intents override this value. To configure a default transaction isolation level, use the constants defined by JDBC: 1 (READ UNCOMMITTED), 2 (READ COMMITTED), 4 (REPEATABLE READ), 8 (SERIALIZABLE).
J2EEResourceProperty.name: webSphereDefaultIsolationLevel

J2EEResourceProperty.description: The name of the client machine where the application resides. If not specified, a default value is used. Refer to the JDBC driver documentation for more information on how the default value is determined.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: workstationID

J2EEResourceProperty.description: Configures whether SQL states compliant with XOPEN or SQL 99 are used.
J2EEResourceProperty.name: xopenStates

KeyStore.description: Key store containing deleted certificates for Dmgr01
KeyStore.name: DmgrDefaultDeletedStore

KeyStore.description: Root certificate key store for Dmgr01
KeyStore.name: DmgrDefaultRootStore

KeyStore.description: Key store containing default signers for Dmgr01
KeyStore.name: DmgrDefaultSignersStore

KeyStore.description: RSAToken root certificate key store for Dmgr01
KeyStore.name: DmgrRSATokenRootStore

Property.description: Trust Association Interceptors in this list will be invoked after Single Sign On user validation.
Property.name: com.ibm.websphere.security.DeferTAItoSSO

Property.description: Allow LTPA authentication when Kerberos is an active authentication mechanism
Property.name: com.ibm.websphere.security.krb.allowLTPAAuth

Property.description: Use canonical host name and key to validate the SPNEGO request
Property.name: com.ibm.websphere.security.krb.canonical_host

Property.description: JGSS credential is not serializable. Do not propagate Kerberos ticket and key
Property.name: com.ibm.ws.security.propagationExcludeList

ThreadPool.description: Service integration bus FAP outbound channel thread pool
ThreadPool.name: SIBFAPThreadPool

ThreadPool.description: Service Integration Bus JMS Resource Adapter thread pool
ThreadPool.name: SIBJMSRAThreadPool

ThreadPool.description: WebSphere MQ common services thread pool
ThreadPool.name: WMQCommonServices

ThreadPool.description: This pool is used by WebSphere during server startup.
ThreadPool.name: server.startup

VariableSubstitutionEntry.description: The filesystem path to the directory which will contain installed enterprise applications.
The name of the IBM Asynchronous Response Servlet application file in the systemApps directory.
The directory that contains the unbranded ConnectJDBC type 4 JDBC Driver for MS SQL Server.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain installed connectors.
The directory that contains the DB2 JDBC Driver on zSeries.

Specifies the fully qualified name of the directory containing native files (e.g., .so files) needed by the DB2 Universal JDBC Driver for processing. Normally the value should be left null. The only time a value should be specified is under WAS z/OS when DB2 V8 or higher is installed. In this case, there are .so files that are installed which are needed for DB2 Universal JDBC Driver processing.
The directory that contains the DB2 Universal JDBC driver.
The directory that contains the DB2 JDBC Driver.
The filesystem path to the installation directory for WebSphere EJB Deployment tool.
The directory that contains the Derby jar files.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain drivers.
The directory that contains the Informix JDBC Driver.
The filesystem path to the Java Virtual Machine installation directory.
The filesystem patch the pointers to the JVM Cache for the current node are held
The name used to refer to the localhost interface.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain server log files.
The filesystem path to the installation directory for WebSphere MQ client libraries.
The directory that contains the Microsoft JDBC driver for MSSQLServer 2000.
The directory that contains the Oracle thin or oci8 JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the native JDBC Driver for local DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains the IBM Toolbox JDBC Driver for remote DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains the Sybase JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the DB2 Universal JDBC driver license file.
The filesystem path to the user installaton directory.
The directory where contains the dirver from Custom JDBC2.0-compliant Provider.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain etc config files.
The product library for the i5/OS WebSphere product installation.
The filesystem path to the WebSphere product installation directory.
The filesystem path to the product lib directory.
The filesystem path to the product properties directory.
The filesystem path to the product temp directory.
The log root directory for server dmgr.
Name of the application server.
